item.title: 1992年にユニビジョンを共同設立し、1995年にDIRECTVラテンアメリカを立ち上げたベネズエラのメディア王グスタボ・シスネロス氏が78歳で死去（Gursimran Kaur/Reuters）
item.description:
Gursimran Kaur / Reuters:
Venezuelan media mogul Gustavo Cisneros, who co-founded Univision in 1992 and launched DIRECTV Latin America in 1995, dies at 78  —  Venezuelan media mogul Gustavo Cisneros, who had expanded Cisneros from a family business into an important conglomerate for the Latin American and U.S. Hispanic market …

item.title: パラマウント・グローバルとComcast Xfinityが新たなキャリッジ契約を結び、CBS、MTV、その他のチャンネルを含む1月1日のブラックアウトの可能性を回避（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
Paramount Global and Comcast Xfinity strike a new carriage deal, averting a potential January 1 blackout that would have included CBS, MTV, and other channels  —  The previous deal was set to expire at the end of the year and would have impacted NFL and college football games.

item.title: ChatGPTやその他のチャットボットを、作家の "ミューズ "である古代の文学的構想の最新の反復として受け入れている作家がいる（A.O.スコット／ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
A.O. Scott / New York Times:
How some authors are embracing ChatGPT and other chatbots as the latest iteration of an ancient literary conceit, a writer's “muse”  —  What happens to literature when writers embrace A.I. as their muse?  —  The robots of literature and movies usually present either an existential danger or an erotic frisson.

item.title: BuzzFeedは、2016年のメディアのスターで、現在時価総額が〜3600万ドルだが、Complex Networksの売却後、2024年末に返済期限を迎える負債の返済に1億ドル強が必要だ（Martin Peers/The Information）。
item.description:
Martin Peers / The Information:
BuzzFeed, the media star of 2016 that now has a ~$36M market cap, needs just above $100M after its sale of Complex Networks to pay down debt due at 2024's end  —  Let's hope all those wannabe digital media entrepreneurs are paying attention to the slow disintegration of BuzzFeed, the media star of 2016.

item.title: DALL-Eのようなシステムが、著作権を侵害する素材を帰属表示やユーザーへの通知なしに作成するため、OpenAIやその他の企業は、より多くの著作権訴訟に直面する可能性が高い（Gary Marcus/Marcus on AI）
item.description:
Gary Marcus / Marcus on AI:
OpenAI and others will likely face more copyright lawsuits as systems like DALL-E produce copyright-infringing materials without attribution or informing users  —  At around the same time as news of the New York Times lawsuit vs OpenAI broke, Reid Southen, the film industry concept artist …

item.title: ネットフリックスの株価は2023年に65％上昇、スポティファイの株価は129％上昇、ロクの株価は126％上昇、ライオンズゲート、ソニー、NBCユニバーサルのオーナーであるコムキャストもメディアセクターの勝者となった。
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter:
Netflix's stock ended 2023 up 65%, Spotify's was up 129%, and Roku's was up 126%; Lionsgate, Sony, and NBCUniversal owner Comcast were also media sector winners  —  Renewed sector deal chatter helped boost some stocks late in the year despite questions about the advertising and streaming outlook.

item.title: 申請中：BuzzFeedのマルセラ・マーティン社長は1月12日付で辞任する意向で、CEOらが彼女の責任を吸収する予定（Jaspreet Singh/Reuters）
item.description:
Jaspreet Singh / Reuters:
Filing: BuzzFeed President Marcela Martin intends to resign on January 12 to pursue other opportunities; the CEO and others plan to absorb her responsibilities  —  BuzzFeed's (BZFD.O) Marcela Martin has announced her intention to resign as president effective Jan. 12 to pursue other opportunities, the digital media firm said on Friday.

item.title: 情報筋BuzzFeedがComplex Networksの大半をライブストリーミング・ショッピングの新興企業Ntwrkに$100M強で売却間近。
item.description:
The Information:
Sources: BuzzFeed is close to selling most of Complex Networks to livestream shopping startup Ntwrk for a little above $100M, far below Jonah Peretti's target  —  After months of discussions, BuzzFeed is close to an agreement to sell most of its Complex Networks business to Ntwrk …

item.title: WBDは、トルコを拠点とし、トルコ語およびアラビア語圏の視聴者向けに2016年に開始されたストリーミングサービスBluTVを、3年間のパートナーシップの後、世界的に買収（Georg Szalai/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Georg Szalai / The Hollywood Reporter:
WBD acquires BluTV, a Turkey-based streaming service launched in 2016 for Turkish- and Arabic-speaking audiences globally, after a three-year partnership  —  The streamer offers premium originals, Turkish TV series and movies, as well as Hollywood and international series and films.

item.title: 2023年、米国で最も視聴されたネットワークはFox Newsで、次いでMSNBC。MSNBCの平均視聴者数は70人、Foxは69人、CNNは67人であった（Alex Griffing/Mediaite）。
item.description:
Alex Griffing / Mediaite:
Fox News was 2023's most watched US network, followed by MSNBC, the only one to grow viewers YoY; MSNBC's average viewer was 70, Fox's was 69, and CNN's was 67  —  The cable news industry had an undeniably rough 2023, ending the tumultuous year with fewer eyeballs as cord-cutting continues …

item.title: 情報源：OpenAIは数ヶ月前から、Gannett、News Corp、IACを含む大手ニュース出版社と、コンテンツのライセンス価格と条件について協議を行ってきた（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Sources: for months, OpenAI has held talks with major news publishers including Gannett, News Corp, and IAC about the price and terms of licensing their content  —  Several major publishers have been in talks to license content to the creator of ChatGPT, but agreement on the price and terms has been elusive.

item.title: 2023年、ロシアの独立メディアはどうなったか：投獄されたメディア関係者は11人から28人に増加し、戦時中の検閲法によってすべての業務を停止せざるを得なくなったメディアもあった（Leyla Latypova/The Moscow Times）
item.description:
Leyla Latypova / The Moscow Times:
How Russia's independent media fared in 2023: imprisoned media workers grew from 11 to 28 as wartime censorship laws forced some outlets to cease all operations  —  The past year has been another troubling one for the Russian free press.  —  Russian officials branded scores of independent news outlets …

item.title: ソーシャルメディアへの有害な投稿を規制するため、企業にモデレーション・ポリシーの開示を求めるカリフォルニア州法AB587を阻止しようとしたX社の訴えを、米判事が却下（ブルームバーグ）。
item.description:
Bloomberg:
A US judge rejects X's bid to block California's AB 587, which seeks to control toxic social media posts by requiring companies to disclose moderation policies  —  - Measure seeks to control toxic posts on social media platforms  — Company alleged state is trying to censor controversial speech

item.title: 調査：米国のニュース業界は2023年1月から11月までに、買収を除いて2681人の雇用を削減し、2022年や2021年の全期間よりも多く、130以上の新聞が閉鎖された（Angela Fu/Poynter）
item.description:
Angela Fu / Poynter:
Research: the US news industry cut 2,681 jobs from January to November 2023, not including buyouts, more than in all of 2022 or 2021, and 130+ newspapers closed  —  It's a sharp reversal from the last two years, when layoffs fell and some news outlets even expanded.

item.title: ニューヨーク・タイムズ紙がOpenAIとマイクロソフトを訴えたのは、著作権によってデータの読み取りと処理の権利が制限されるという誤った考えに基づいている（Mike Masnick/Techdirt）
item.description:
Mike Masnick / Techdirt:
The New York Times' lawsuit against OpenAI and Microsoft relies on a false belief that copyright can limit the right to read and process data  —  This week the NY Times somehow broke the story of... well, the NY Times suing OpenAI and Microsoft.  I wonder who tipped them off.
